meaningMnemonic: A <radical>shellfish</radical> that can't live through <radical>winter</radical> is a <kanji>failure</kanji>. Any proper shellfish would survive through the winter, so this is quite an embarrassing <kanji>defeat</kanji>.
readingMnemonic: The best way to avoid <kanji>failure</kanji> is to say a little <reading>hai</reading>ku (はい) to distract you from the cold. In fact, this can work in any situation where you're afraid of defeat. Say a haiku aloud, it will calm your nerves and warm you from the inside.
